conclusion: To determine the distance fallen, analyze the area under the v-t graph for the interval.
The area under the v-t graph represents the distance traveled.
The interval of interest is from t = 10 seconds to t = 15 seconds.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is approximately 20 m/s.
At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is approximately 10 m/s.
The graph between t = 10 seconds and t = 15 seconds appears to be a straight line.
The graph indicates a constant deceleration.
The area under the graph can be approximated as a trapezoid.
The formula for the area of a trapezoid is: Area = 1/2 × (Base1 + Base2) × Height.
Base1 = 20 m/s, Base2 = 10 m/s, and Height = 5 seconds.
The area under the graph from t = 10 seconds to t = 15 seconds is exactly 75 meters.
The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is exactly 75 meters.
